titles.title: To require the Secretary of Homeland Security to submit a report on cyber vulnerability disclosures, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Homeland Security.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Homeland Security. H. Rept. 115-283.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 203.

action.text: Mr. Estes (KS) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3202.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary:
Cyber Vulnerability Disclosure Reporting Act
This bill requires the Department of Homeland Security to provide a public report to Congress about the policies and procedures developed for coordinating disclosures about cyber vulnerabilities. The report may contain a classified portion about cyber vulnerability disclosures made in the past year and those outcomes.
